svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Foreign direct investment, net inflows (% of GDP)
Foreign direct investments are defined as the net inflows of investment to acquire a lasting management interest in an
enterprise operating in an economy. This series shows net inflows (new investment inflows less disinvestment) in the
reporting economy from foreign investors, divided by GDP.
Source: Foreign direct investment, net inflows (% of GDP) - World Bank WDI (2015)
